result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion for Additional Discovery

Defendant Jordan-Anthony J Roberson appeared by video.  Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Melissa Louise Barrette appeared by video for Jordan-Anthony J Roberson.
Attorney Barrette informs the Court that the defense has received some new information which must be explored further.  This will likely result in motions being filed.  The defendant confirms that he is willing to withdraw his speedy trial demand, as it will require time beyond the currently scheduled trial date on July 19th.
Court grants defense's motion to withdraw its speedy trial demand. 
Status conference set for 07-19-2022 at 11:30am via Zoom.   (Trial removed from the calendar)
Status conference on July 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine.
Jury trial on July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2022 at 08:45 am.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify bond is denied for the reasons stated on the record on May 18, 2022.

12:11 PM   Defendant Jordan-Anthony J Roberson appeared by video, in custody.    Attorney Melissa Louise Barrette appeared by video for Jordan-Anthony J Roberson. Attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests a reduction of cash bail and argues why a modification would be appropriate at this time.  State argues against any modification and places its reasons on the record.  Based upon the severity of the charges, maximum penalties and history of conduct while out on bail, the Court finds that  a modification is not appropriate.  State to draft order.  
Next court date is a status/scheduling conference on June 15, 2022 at 10:15 a.m.
Motion hearing on May 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-23-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.

Sara Stertz, through Public Defender.
Victim Identification Key.
Re:  First degree recklessly endangering safety, with use of dangerous weapon, on 02-06-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of felony bail jumping and reckless endangerment with use of a dangerous weapon.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-14-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $25,000.00 cash bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release and defendant is not to possess any weapons.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.
Minutes.
